Package felixcaban.controllers

Class AddPartFormController

  • java.lang.Object
    • felixcaban.controllers.AddPartFormController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class AddPartFormController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    FXML Controller class for AddPartForm.fxml. The controller for the UI to add a new Part to Inventory.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    felix.caban

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle rb)
        Initializes the controller class. Sets the initial UI control properties.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        url - an optional URL that can be passed.
        rb - an optional ResourceBundle that can be passed.

      • handleRbInHouseAction

        private void handleRbInHouseAction​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Handles the radio button for InHouse parts being added to inventory. If selected, a InHouse part will be created.
        Parameters:
        event - on action.

      • handleRbOutsourcedAction

        private void handleRbOutsourcedAction​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Handles the radio button for Outsourced parts being added to inventory. If selected, a Outsourced part will be created.
        Parameters:
        event - on action.

      • handleBtnCancelAction

        private void handleBtnCancelAction​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Handles the button to cancel adding the Part to inventory. It then returns the user to the MainForm.
        Parameters:
        event - on action.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the user can not be returned to the MainForm.

      • handleBtnSaveAction

        private void handleBtnSaveAction​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Handles the button to save the entered Part being added to inventory. Also perform validation on user input to ensure that all fields are complete and all data types match.
        Parameters:
        event - on action.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the user can not be returned to the MainForm.

      • returnToMainForm

        private void returnToMainForm​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the user to the MainForm.
        Parameters:
        event - on action.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if the user can not be returned to the MainForm.

      • validateUserInput

        private void validateUserInput()
        Validates the UI text box input. If errors are found, they are added to the inputError list.
